abuse: Modesty; their fear of taking risks; their passive resistance towards innovations.
emotions: Calculated moderation; eagerness to serve, to adapt to others.
goal: Maintain the status quo, control the environment.
influence_others_by: Their constancy in performance; for their desire to serve, to adapt to the needs of others.
its_value_for: Plan in the short term; it is predictable, it is congruent; maintains a uniform and safe rhythm.
judge_others_by: The norms of friendship, later for their ability.
more_effective_if: Share your ideas more; build your self-confidence based on the feedback you receive; use simpler and more direct methods.

The Specialist “gets along” with others. Due to his moderate and controlled attitude and his modest behavior, he can work in harmony with different styles of behavior. The Specialist is considered patient and is always ready to help those he considers his friends. In fact, he tends to develop a close relationship with a relatively small group of colleagues at work.

Strives to maintain known and predictable behavior patterns. The Specialist, being quite efficient in specialized areas, plans his work, focuses it clearly and directly and achieves a remarkable constancy in his performance. The recognition you receive from others helps you maintain this level.

The Specialist is slow to adapt to changes. Advance preparation gives you the time you need to change your procedures and maintain your level of performance. The Specialist may need help to start a new project and to develop practical and simple methods to meet established deadlines. He usually sets aside the finished projects for later completion. A little tip: throw away some of those old folders from your archive!
under_pressure: It adapts to those who have authority and to what the group thinks.
